{"id":1758706579,"question_id":3981,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"2 months, 2 weeks","timestamp":1756934223,"status":11,"status_display":"Wrong Answer","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/1758706579/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Jump Game IX","memory":"N/A","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    vector<int> maxValue(vector<int>& nums) {\n        int N = (int)nums.size();\n        vector<pair<int, int>> mx(N), mn(N); // mx: smallest index, mn: biggest index\n\n        pair<int, int> cur = {-1, -1};\n        for (int i=0; i<N; i++) {\n            cur = max(cur, {nums[i], -i});\n            mx[i] = cur;\n        }\n        cur = {INT_MAX, INT_MAX};\n        for (int i=N-1; i>=0; i--) {\n            cur = min(cur, {nums[i], -i});\n            mn[i] = cur;\n        }\n\n        vector<int> ans(N);\n        for (int i=0; i<N; i++) {\n            int idx = -mn[i].second;\n            int val = mn[i].first;\n\n            ans[i] = nums[i];\n            if (val < nums[i] && nums[idx] < mx[idx].first) {\n                ans[i] = max(ans[i], mx[idx].first);\n            }\n            if (nums[i] < mx[i].first) {\n                ans[i] = max(ans[i], mx[i].first);\n            }\n        }\n\n        return ans;\n    }\n    // case: everything to the right of max value is just max value\n    // requirement: need a data structure/system that gives the SMALLEST VALUE w/ CERTAIN INDEX to the right\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"jump-game-ix","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1,"frontend_id":1183}
